page.title: 05CLITHEROE'S QUARRY SITE.
page.content: Salthill Quarry is to be found on the outskirts of Clitheroe. Lime was once the staple trade of Clitheroe and the site was originally quarried for limestone for building and industrial purposes. From the early part of this century the quarrying activity has eventually ceased. In recent years there has been pressure in the town to provide a new industrial area which would not intrude into the surrounding country- side. There was also growing pressure from people with an interest in geology to visit this quarry site. As a result the quarry has been reclaimed and forms the site of a developing industrial estate. At the same time a geological trail has been planned and constructed on this new development.
